page.title: 06Transport in Hannington
page.content: The village is situated 2 miles from the main road (A339) & only has the service of a bus on market days, Wed_ nesdays & Saturdays _ destination Basingstoke & villages in between. Therefore, private transport is essen_ tial. Some families have two or more cars but many elderly rely on the bus service. At the age of 16 youngsters buy 50cc motorbikes as soon as they can afford them, & graduate to a car at the earliest opportunity. School_ children who attend the designated school in Kingsclere are transported by a private coach _ others have to be taken to school by Parents. The roads are single track with 'passing' cut _ outs, & large vehicles have difficulty driving through the village. A small privately run airstrip exists used by enthusiasts of light aircraft.
